lines.gurmukhi: jYsy imRgrwj qn jMbuk ADIn hoq; Kg pq suq jwie juhwrq kwg hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as a cub becomes subservient to a jackal or a Garud (Ardea argala) bows to a crow.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs Bwˆq imRgrwj qnu Syr dw b`cw igdV dy ADIn hovy, qy gruV dw b`cw jw ky kwˆ nUM m`Qw tykdw hovy,

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy rwh kyq bs igRhn mY suirqr; soB n Ark bn riv sis lwig hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as Sun and Moon resides in the houses of Rahu and Ketu (the two unfriendly mythological demons), or Kalapbrichh the all giving tree of heavens does not fit into the jungle of Calotropis procera.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ rwhU kyqU dy Grwˆ AMdr sUrj cMd dw invws qy klp ibrC dw A`kwˆ dy jMgl ivc lgnw soBdw nhIˆ hY, vw cMgw nhIˆ lgdw hY,

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kwmDyn suq sUkrI sQn pwn; AYrwpq suq grDb AgRBwg hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as a calf of ever milk-yielding cow (Kamdhenu) sucks the teats of a she pig, or the young one of Airawat the elephant of god Inder keeps bowing before a donkey.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ kwm DynU dw pu`q v`Cw sUrI dy Qn pIvy qy ieMdR dy AYrwpiq hwQI dw b`cw KoqI dy Agy pvy, Es qoˆ pÎwr nwl ctvwvy ieh g`lwˆ nhIˆ cMgIAwˆ lgdIAwˆ,

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK suq Awn dyv syvk huie; inhPl jnmu ijau bMs mY bjwig hY [477[

Unknown.translation: Similarly, if son of a Guru's Sikh starts worshipping gods and goddesses, his human birth would be a failure just as a son of two fathers would be in a respectable family.  (477)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqsy pRkwr hI gurU ky is`K dw puqR BI jykr Awn dyviqAwˆ dw syvk bx jwvy qwˆ Es dw jnm hI inhPl AjweIˆ jwˆdw smJnw auh bMs ivc bjwig b`j klMk vwkUM hI huMdw hY ]477]
